nodes.bodyText: Please share if there are more relevant serializations in the code which we want to capture
fyi - I am not removing this onBeforeSendRequest , moving it early in the stack to getCreateDocumentRequest method , ensuring we are capturing meta data (collection calls) in retries
the purpose of getCreateDocumentRequest is just to create the request. retry-policy interaction should happen outside. why are we moving this?
I think it is Metadata not MetaData
I noticed in the resultant diagnostics string some fields are utc and some have timezone. I wonder why you have the mix of the two?
trying to move every time to utc to avoid confusion during debugging
metaData -> metadata here and other places please

why are we preferring this approach over having a start timer and end timer before and after serialization?
this way you have to change every deserialization() code to a () -> deserialization() ?

This way we need not to put start,end time and adding it to the serialization list , that logic can be confined in one place.  There are some places where we can't use getResource() due to unavailability of serialization context  such as in getCreateDocumentRequest() in RxDocumentClientImpl.java , so for those we have addSerializationDiagnostics() as you suggesting.
removed callable as it was have some perf cost
this is .Net naming style. the enum types should have java naming style.

I am guessing this can be accessed from multiple threads. Then shouldn't this be a synchronized list?
see this similar race condition bug in the diagnostics string: #8505

I am guessing this can be accessed from multiple threads. Then shouldn't this be a synchronized list?
see this similar race condition bug in the diagnostics string: #8505

as you are invoking this in the deserialization codepath it should have the same behaviour in terms of exception throwing.
This changes the exception type.

All the places where this method is getting called are eventually throwing IllegalArgumentException via  JsonSerializable.  So either we throw  IllegalArgumentException  or let it be the way we have now IllegalStateException wraps IllegalArgumentException, thoughts ? And if we agree on removing getResource() method altogether measuring pros and cons, that this problem will be solved itself.

I am guessing this can be accessed from multiple threads. Then shouldn't this be a synchronized list?
see this similar race condition bug in the diagnostics string: #8505

also a general question, you changed the deserialization() -> () -> deserialization() everywhere thourhgout the code.
Any reason we are not capturing the start and end time of deserialization and pass here only the time window?

This way we need not to put start,end time and adding it to the serialization list , that logic can be confined in one place.  There are some places where we can't use getResource() due to unavailability of serialization context  such as in getCreateDocumentRequest() in RxDocumentClientImpl.java , so for those we have addSerializationDiagnostics() as you suggesting.
removed callable
this is .Net naming for enum. change to Java
why do we need explicit priority = 1 here?

Because we want gatewayDiagnostics() and directDiagnostics() to run before gatewayDiagnosticsOnException and directDiagnosticsOnException(), other wise we wont able to test CONTAINER_LOOK_UP and PARTITION_KEY_RANGE_LOOK_UP with 100% of surety in either of these.

as you are using UTC everywhere, please see if Instant is more appropriate or ZonedDataTime.
as Instance is UTC only I am guessing it might have better perf.
Please do a jmh perf run as discussed offline to compare the two.

InstantVsZonedDateTime.instantTime       thrpt    5  323658648.596 ± 21659882.776  ops/s
InstantVsZonedDateTime.zonedDateTime     thrpt    5  126614135.659 ±  5709318.981  ops/s
InstantVsZonedDateTime.zonedDateTimeUTC  thrpt    5  124846883.459 ± 16047362.965  ops/s
As per the above number instantTime is performing good.
How ever I ran the regular ReadThroughput benchmark with and without PR , results are same, so in overall end to end test it is not making noticeable difference.
However it make sense to use instantTime  if we want UTC . So we have three ways from here onward

Change all the zonedDateTimeUTC   to instantTime  throughout the code(at least in all diagnostics in a separate PR soon after this) and merge this PR
Changed  zonedDateTimeUTC  to instantTime only in the scope of this PR
Changed  all the zonedDateTimeUTC   to instantTime with this PR itself .

I am inclined toward 1 as it will be cleaner and more modular.
@simplynaveen20 Let's do 1 as a separate PR - we should change ZonedDateTimeUTC to instantTime. There is no need for ZonedDateTimeUTC in SDK, as everything should be in UTC.
option 1 makes sense.

the purpose of getCreateDocumentRequest is to create the request. Why retryPolicy is passed here?
whoever invokes getCreateDocumentRequest should handle requestRetryPolicy not this method.
discussed offline
is this needed?
